caption.p: Protective role of Lactoferrin (LF) in SARS-CoV infection. (A) LF blocks the infection of SARS-CoV by binding to cell surface heparan sulfate proteoglycans (HSPGs). (B) In absence of LF, the anchoring sites provided by HSPGs allow the initial contact between SARS-CoV and host cells. SARS-CoV scans for specific entry receptors, which leads to subsequent cell entry. [From Lang et al., 2011), modified].
